emuInput.TitMainTitle: Rush Party participants and guests of Alpha Gamma Chi Sorority, from left, floor: Lillian Adams and Elaine Gibson; second row: Elie Steinberg, Thelma Miller, Willa Mae Rice, and Willa Rose; standing: Ann Robinson, Erma Petett, Barbara James, Melusena Carl, Palestine Zellares, and Dorothy Kendrick, gathered in interior
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 2, 1953, pg. 12, reads: "Sorors In 'Tuneful Togs' - Some of the sorors and guests attending the Rush Party given by Alpha Gamma Chapter of Alpha Gamma Chi Sorority, April 25, pose in togs which represent tunes. On the floor: Lillian Adams, left depicts 'Schooldays'; Elaine Gibson 'Dance Ballerina Dance.'  Second row, left to right, Elie Steinberg and Thelma Miller are a 'Mexican Hat Dance team,' Willa Mae Rice, sponsor, sports her 'Easter Bonnet,' and Willa Rose 'Sweet Violets.'  Standing, left to right: Ann Robinson is costumed for 'Carmen'; Erma Petett for "Don't Let the Stars Get in Your Eyes"; Barbara James wears a 'Gray Bonnet with Blue Ribbon on it,' and Melusena Carl has 'Buttons and Bows' all over.  Palestine Zellares and Dorothy Kendricks are not in costume.  Soror Elaine Gibson was party hostess.  Harris Photo."
